content: The Great Pyramid of Giza was built over 4,500 years ago and was the tallest building in the world for almost 4,000 years!
Pharaohs were considered gods on Earth. They wore special crowns and had their names written in hieroglyphs!
Cats were sacred animals in Ancient Egypt. They were so important that harming a cat was against the law!
Ancient Egyptians wrote on papyrus scrolls made from river plants. These were the first books!
King Tutankhamun's tomb contained over 5,000 precious objects, including a golden mask!
Mummies were wrapped in linen bandages and placed in decorated sarcophagi to protect them in the afterlife.
The Great Sphinx has the body of a lion and the head of a human. It guards the pyramids of Giza!
Scribes were very important people who could read and write hieroglyphs. They kept records of everything!
The Colosseum could hold 50,000 people! It had elevators and trapdoors for spectacular gladiator shows.
Gladiators were fighters who battled in the arena. Many were heroes to the Roman people!
Roman soldiers marched in formation and built roads wherever they went. All roads led to Rome!
Roman shields were rectangular and could be locked together to form a 'tortoise' formation for protection.
Roman coins showed the faces of emperors and were used all across the empire for trade.
Romans built beautiful marble statues of their gods, emperors, and heroes that still exist today!
Chariot races were the most popular sport in Rome. Drivers raced around the Circus Maximus track!
Senators wore white togas with purple stripes and made important decisions for the Roman Empire.
T-Rex had teeth as big as bananas! It was one of the largest land predators that ever lived.
Triceratops had three horns and a bony frill to protect itself from predators like T-Rex!
Pterodactyls weren't actually dinosaurs - they were flying reptiles that lived alongside dinosaurs!
Fossils are like nature's photographs - they show us what dinosaurs looked like millions of years ago!
Volcanoes were very active during dinosaur times. Some scientists think they helped end the age of dinosaurs.
Giant ferns covered the Earth during dinosaur times. Plant-eating dinosaurs munched on them like salad!
Dinosaur eggs came in many sizes - some were as small as marbles, others as big as footballs!
Dinosaur footprints tell us how fast they walked, if they traveled in groups, and how big they were!
